# Introduction {.unnumbered}

Predator hunting mode plays a crucial role in structuring ecological communities and ecosystems [@hueyEcologicalConsequencesForaging1981; @preisserPredatorHuntingMode2007; @schmitzEffectsPredatorHunting2008; @romeroContrastingCascadeEffects2011; @kersch-beckerCommunitywideResponsesPredation2018]. In recent years, there has been a growing interest in investigating how ecological factors shape individual variation in hunting behaviour within populations, and how these differences may alter predator-prey interactions [@pettorelliChapterTwoIndividual2015; @schmitzPredatorPreyFunctional2017].
